About Me

"Determination, Hard Work, Fun"

Unity Game and Interactive AR/VR/MR App Developer with 8+ years of industry experience, delivering scalable games and interactive experiences for multinational clients. Specialized in full-cycle development, R&D, prototyping, multiplayer, game front-end and backend, designing and leading cross-functional teams. Open to on-site, hybrid, and remote roles.

Virtual Event Platform

(Immersive Social Experience)

[Professional Project]
Previous Next

Virtual Event Platform (VEP) is an industry agnostic solution, which allows event organizers and exhibitors to harness the power of VR and gamification to create interactive, online events that eliminate the need for common logistical and travel-related expenses. The VEP brings people together regardless of their location in a virtual multiplayer environment. Including gamification features like avatar customization, user data logging, multiplayer interactions, cross platform support, real-time event systems. It can be experienced using Google VR as well.

Role: Team lead, Lead developer

Platforms: Android, iOS, Windows, Mac, WebGL, Mobile VR

Tools Used:

  • Unity Game Engine
  • Photon PUN and Fusion Multiplayer
  • Janus Server WebRTC
  • Websockets
  • Blender
  • Substance Painter
  • Adobe Photoshop
  • JSON

(A product of AVIANET. All rights reserved by AVIANET)


Predictive Maintenance

(AR Android, iOS, Hololens App)

[Professional Project]
Previous Next

Today, manufacturing and other industries are trying to improve their competitiveness by combining manufacturing and other business processes with information technology. Virtual & Augmented Realities are being used in training of technical workforce, machine maintenance, product development processes across enterprises as a helpful technology to achieve rapid consolidation of information and decision-making through visualization and experience. Harnessing the power of speech recognition, the user can perform checks just by voice commands. Train workers and mitigate risks before hand.

Role: Lead Designer & Lead developer

Platforms: Android, iOS, Hololens

Tools Used:

  • Unity Game Engine
  • Vuforia AR
  • Blender
  • Adobe Photoshop
  • IBM Watson Speech Synthesis

(A product of AVIANET. All rights reserved by AVIANET)


Product Showcasing AR

(AR Realtime Product Showcase)

[Freelance Project]
Previous Next

What if you are able to check and place a product in your surrounding before purchasing it? The product showcasing AR app enables the user to select a product from a list of products available, fetched in realtime from backend database. And can place in their surrounding using surface/ground detection feature of AR. The producer has the ability to easily upload model and info of the product in the backend which can be fetched by consumers in realtime.

Role: Designer & developer

Platforms: Android

Tools Used:

  • Unity Game Engine
  • Blender
  • Substance Painter
  • Adobe Photoshop
  • ARCore
  • MySQL
  • JSON
  • Unity Assetbundles
  • Backend Server

AR Baggage Management

(AR Measurement)

[Professional Project]
Previous Next

Most of the time people find it difficult to comprehend the required size of the hand baggage, that could fit into the airplane compartment. AR baggage management application provides a quick measuring tool that the users can use to measure their lagguage prior to their boarding. As the application is built on AR technology it is much easier and quicker to get the size checked.

Role: Designer & developer

Design Pattern Examples

(Github Project)

[Learning Resource]
Previous Next

I've led multiple teams, conducted code reviews, and interviewed game developers. Many of them say they know their design patterns, but they're hesitant to apply them in their code, which often ends up being pretty messy. Some have also mentioned that they donâ€™t fully understand where to apply certain patterns because there aren't enough game related examples out there. So, my motivation for creating this project is to help game developers better understand useful design patterns and their use cases, through interactive examples. I've tried to keep it as simple as possible and added tutorial docs for each pattern. I have covered few of the most important Design Patterns used in game dev.

View on GitHub


Tools Used:

  • Unity Game Engine
  • Singleton Pattern
  • State Machine Pattern
  • Observer Pattern
  • Command Pattern

Scribble Booth

(User Engagement App)

[Freelance Project]
Previous Next

I created a fun and interactive user engagement application where users write messages on a mirror from the opposite side, and the app records the text as it would appear correctly mirrored. The app uses real-time reflection detection to capture the reversed writing, and then displays it in its correct orientation on the screen. Once the message is captured, users can print the mirrored image or share it via a QR code, making it easy to take their creative work with them. This app adds an interactive twist to writing and sharing, turning the act of mirroring into a playful and unique experience.
